About the Package ================================ KVM (for Kernel-based Virtual Machine) is a full virtualization solution for Linux on x86 hardware containing virtualization extensions (Intel VT or AMD-V). It consists of a loadable kernel module, kvm.ko, that provides the core virtualization infrastructure and a processor specific module, kvm-intel.ko or kvm-amd.ko. Using KVM, one can run multiple virtual machines running unmodified Linux or Windows images. Each virtual machine has private virtualized hardware: a network card, disk, graphics adapter, etc.
=Supported versions= QEMU emulator version 2.2.0 =Setup= The Agent must be installed on KVM enabled machine. =Setup= * API version and https port can be configured in this VARA based on your environment. =Common Inputs= (None) =Actions= Following actions are supported.
* Action name: PCK.AUTOMIC_KVM.PUB.ACTION.CLONE_VM * Action Description: Clone a VM from an existing VM.
* Action name: PCK.AUTOMIC_KVM.PUB.ACTION.LIST_VMS * Action Description: List VMs from an existing VM.
* Action name: PCK.AUTOMIC_KVM.PUB.ACTION.DELETE_VM * Action Description: Delete VM from existing VM.
* Action name: PCK.AUTOMIC_KVM.PUB.ACTION.GET_VM_INFO * Action Description: Retrieves VM information.
